sets.name: Stance Set 1
sets.intro: This set demonstrates the 22 fundamental stances and their transitions. It emphasizes smooth, controlled movement between stances, developing balance, coordination, and awareness of foot maneuvers used throughout techniques and forms.

sets.title: SET 1: Stance Transitions — Flow and Continuity

steps.text: Attention stance.
Left leg steps out into a Horse stance.
Left leg moves back into a Right Neutral Bow.
Right leg slides back into a Right 45° Cat Stance.
Right leg steps back into a Horse stance.
Right leg moves back into a Left Neutral Bow.
Left leg slides back into a Left 45° Cat Stance.
Left leg crosses back into a Right Twist Stance.
Unwind into a Right Neutral Bow.
Right leg moves back into a Left Twist Stance.
Unwind into a Left Neutral Bow.
Rotate into a Right Reverse Bow.
Rotate in place into a Left Forward Bow.
Front-to-Back switch.
Rotate into a Left Reverse Bow.
Rotate in place into a Right Forward Bow.
Transition into a Right Rotating Twist Stance.
Step through forward to continue motion.
Transition into a Left Rotating Twist Stance.
Unwind into a Left Neutral Bow.
Left leg steps back into a Horse stance.
Left leg moves in to Attention stance.

footerNotes: There are 22 stances in this set. Each transition teaches balance, flow, and awareness of foot placement.
Focus on keeping your weight centered and transitions smooth—avoid bouncing or shifting abruptly.
Hidden within this set are numerous foot maneuvers necessary for seamless stance changes found in techniques and forms.
